attributes.action: Leave or remain in the EU referendum to be held in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
I do not think that Mr Cameron can renegotiate our terms of membership, the British people are being ignored. £12 billion in cuts to the British people, a million people using food banks yet we give £20 BILLION to the EU & £12 BILLION in foreign aid. A BILLION pounds has gone to Syria. Nearly 200,000 homeless in the UK yet we can take in thousands more? 
Sign this petition so your voice can finally be heard, we want a referendum, not renegotiation of membership.
attributes.background: Mr Cameron has said he will hold a referendum IF he cannot renegotiate terms of our membership. We don't want renegotiation, we want out. The referendum should be held in 2016 and the people that elected him should be listened to. It's not for Mr Cameron to decide what the British public want.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104838

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
